item.title: Python and R
item.description: The reticulate package letâ€™s R and python work together! Simply define something in the R code chunk library(reticulate) so<- "Stay Healthy" then define something in the python code chunk. After you print out the result you can show your message! cool="Everyone" print(r.so,cool) These are hard times for many people so here are some memes to brighten your day!

item.title: Neha's Project Topics
item.description: Project Topics I decided to analyze traffic data for my projects because driving is something most of us can relate to. Driving is a daily activity that most of us do not think about when we are doing it but there are many things that can subconsciously contribute to how we drive. I chose to analyze data regarding the presence of traffic cameras, as well as laws we are aware of to see if it had any effect on how safe people drive.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Projects Here are some projects I have recently completed: Exploratory Data Analysis with Tidyverse Tools Modeling, Testing, and Classification

item.title: Project 1
item.description: Neha Momin nbm522 Introduction The first dataset is bad_drivers and it contains information on the number of drivers involved in a fatal collision per billion miles, the percent of drivers involved in a collision while speeding, percent of drivers in a collision that were alcohol impaired, the percent of drivers that were not distracted during the collision, the percent of drivers in a collision with no previous accidents, the average insurance premiums by state, and the losses incurred by the insurance companies for collisions per insured driver.

item.title: Project 2
item.description: Neha Momin nbm522 R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. When you click the Knit button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:
